intro: Merostachys ciliata, commonly known as the silky grass or silky bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and fine, hairy leaves that give it a silky appearance. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Merostachys ciliata is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its delicate foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
